sentences.sContent: Since time immemorial, the whale has been wreathed in mystery—and of course it almost predates time itself, having existed long before the land around which it swims.
sentences.sContent_eng: Since time immemorial, the whale has been wreathed in mystery—and of course it almost predates time itself, having existed long before the land around which it swims.
sentences.sCn: 自远古以来，鲸鱼一直被披上神秘的色彩--当然它们也的确几乎与时间一样古老，它们存在的时间比它们游过的陆地的历史还长。

synos.tran: 远古的，古老的；无法追忆的

phrases.pCn: 远古以来；太古时代；很久以前；法律不能追溯的年代

remMethod.val: im(不) + memor(记住) + ial → 在记忆之外的 → 太古的

trans.tranCn: 古老的, 远古的, 无法追忆的
